thread.title: Chandler police: Woman rammed police car, tried to run over officer
thread.title_full: Chandler police: Woman rammed police car, tried to run over officer

author: Alessandra Luckey , The Republic | azcentral.com
title: Chandler police: Woman rammed police car, tried to run over officer
text:
Enriqutta Martha Herrera (Photo: Maricopa County Sheriff's Office) 
90 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE A woman was booked on two charges after Chandler police accused her of ramming a police car with her vehicle and attempting to run over an officer Monday afternoon, police said.
Enriqutta Martha Herrera, 33, was booked on suspicion of aggravated assault and unlawful flight, said Sgt. Daniel Mejia, a Chandler Police Department spokesman.
Herrera initially was reported as a possible impaired driver by a bystander shortly after 1:45 p.m., Mejia said. A Chandler police officer tried to conduct a traffic stop on Herrera, who was driving a blue Chrysler sedan, on Arizona Avenue and Chandler Heights Road, Mejia said.
The officer watched the sedan speed southbound on Arizona Avenue approaching Chandler Heights, Mejia said.
During the traffic stop, Herrera refused to roll down the window and backed into the police car, Mejia said. She then put the car in drive and drove toward the officer.
As the officer backed out of the way, he tripped on a raised concrete median and suffered minor injuries to his hand, Mejia said.
The vehicle headed east on Riggs Road at a high speed, and Maricopa County Sheriff's Office deputies located the sedan on Power Road just south of Riggs Road, Mejia said.
The woman refused to exit the vehicle, so Chandler officers broke a passenger-side window to unlock the doors and Herrera was taken into custody, Mejia said.
A second officer suffered minor cuts while attempting to break the car window.
Herrera was not impaired, Mejia said. He said the reasons behind the alleged actions were not immediately known.
